reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Training plan and implementation of the National Brucellosis Program in Bolivia

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award From June 3-17, 2016, the Training Plan and Implementation of the National Brucellosis Program was held in Bolivia. The training Assisted Bolivia by providing an in-depth training (i.e., “train-the-trainers) to National and Departmental personnel responsible for coordinating and managing the Brucellosis Control & Eradication Program, emphasizing the epidemiology of brucellosis and the short-term tools to be used to control and eradicate the disease in Bolivia as indicated in the newly revised National Strategy..

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. assistance provides training and targeted support for Bolivian counternarcotics efforts; helps the Bolivian military in its peacekeeping and natural disaster response roles; improves healthcare quality and access; conserves biodiversity; and strengthens local governments and citizen participation. The United States will work with the Government of Bolivia (GOB), civil society, and the private sector to promote a more democratic state, healthier population, and improved environmental conservation. (Source: Congressional Budget Justification FY 2014)

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Salaries and Expenses, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agriculture
